what: Access to the List of Birds Species of Peru
title: Access to the List of Birds Species of Peru
text: avesperu package opens door Peru’s extraordinary birds, comprising approximately 1,892 species, making one world’s diverse bird-rich countries. comprehensive R package provides users access meticulously documented “List Birds Peru” M. . Plenge. ’s worth noting avian taxonomy dynamic, dramatic changes time. Bird species categorization refined based articles, published photographs, sound recordings accredited institutions, . species list follows taxonomic classification endorsed South American Checklist Committee (SACC), assigns species codes reflecting residency status, endemism, migratory behavior, vagrancy, introductions, extirpation, hypothetical presence. now, SACC process recognizing certain subspecies full species, development alter species count. “H” category, signifies hypothetical species, now ranked fifth South America, following Argentina, Bolivia, Colombia, Ecuador. anticipated ranking diminish well-documented records published.  Suggested citation:
code: citation("avesperu") #> To cite avesperu in publications use: #>  #>   Santos - Andrade, PE. (2023). avesperu: Access to the List of Birds #>   Species of Peru. R package version 0.0.0.1. #>  #> A BibTeX entry for LaTeX users is #>  #>   @Manual{, #>     title = {avesperu: Access to the List of Birds Species of Peru}, #>     author = {Paul E. Santos - Andrade}, #>     year = {2023}, #>     note = {R package version 0.0.0.1}, #>   } #>  #> To cite the avesperu dataset, please use: Plenge, M. A. Version #> [07/06/2023] List of the birds of Peru / Lista de las aves del Perú. #> Unión de Ornitólogos del Perú: #> https://sites.google.com/site/boletinunop/checklist

title: Access to the List of Birds Species of Peru
text: can install avesperu package CRAN using: Also can install development version avesperu like :

title: Access to the List of Birds Species of Peru
text: ’s quick example use avesperu package: package provides access list bird species recorded Peru also excels resolving potential typos variations species names fuzzy matching. ensures accurate retrieval intelligently recognizing accommodating slight discrepancies input names, making robust tool working diverse sometimes inconsistent datasets.
code: library(avesperu) #> This is avesperu 0.0.1  splist <- c("Falco sparverius",             "Tinamus osgodi",             "Crypturellus sooui",             "Thraupisa palamarum",             "Thamnophilus praecox")  search_avesperu(splist = splist, max_distance = 0.05) #>       name_submitted     accepted_name     english_name        spanish_name #> 1   Falco sparverius  Falco sparverius American Kestrel Cernícalo Americano #> 2     Tinamus osgodi   Tinamus osgoodi    Black Tinamou        Perdiz Negra #> 3 Crypturellus sooui Crypturellus soui   Little Tinamou        Perdiz Chica #>           order     family status dist #> 1 Falconiformes Falconidae   nill    0 #> 2  Tinamiformes  Tinamidae   nill    1 #> 3  Tinamiformes  Tinamidae   nill    1 splist <- c("Falco sparverius",             "Tinamus osgodi",             "Crypturellus sooui",             "Thraupisa palamarum",             "Thraupisa palamarum",             "Thamnophilus praecox")  search_avesperu(splist = splist, max_distance = 0.1) #> The following names are repeated in the 'splist': Thraupisa palamarum #>        name_submitted     accepted_name     english_name        spanish_name #> 1    Falco sparverius  Falco sparverius American Kestrel Cernícalo Americano #> 2      Tinamus osgodi   Tinamus osgoodi    Black Tinamou        Perdiz Negra #> 3  Crypturellus sooui Crypturellus soui   Little Tinamou        Perdiz Chica #> 4 Thraupisa palamarum Thraupis palmarum     Palm Tanager Tangara de Palmeras #>           order     family status dist #> 1 Falconiformes Falconidae   nill    0 #> 2  Tinamiformes  Tinamidae   nill    1 #> 3  Tinamiformes  Tinamidae   nill    1 #> 4 Passeriformes Thraupidae   nill    2

title: avesperu_tab Dataset — avesperu_tab
text: avesperu_tab dataset contains tibble provides information bird species recorded Peru, based "List Birds Peru" M. . Plenge. includes details scientific names, English names, Spanish names, order, family, status species.

title: avesperu_tab Dataset — avesperu_tab
text: tibble 1,892 rows 6 columns: scientific_name Scientific name bird species. english_name English common name bird species. spanish_name Spanish common name bird species. order order bird species belongs. family family bird species belongs. status Status bird species (e.g., resident, endémic, migratory, etc.).

title: avesperu_tab Dataset — avesperu_tab
text: dataset designed provide users comprehensive information avian species found Peru, documented M. . Plenge. organized easy access utilization within R environment.

title: avesperu_tab Dataset — avesperu_tab
text: dataset based "List Birds Peru" M. . Plenge.

title: avesperu_tab Dataset — avesperu_tab
text: Data compilation: M. . Plenge, Package implementation: Paul Efren Santos Andrade

title: avesperu_tab Dataset — avesperu_tab
code: # Load the avesperu package library(avesperu)  # Access the avesperu_tab dataset data("avesperu_tab")  # Display the first few rows head(avesperu_tab) #>             scientific_name           english_name            spanish_name #> 1              Rhea pennata            Lesser Rhea            Ñandú Petizo #> 2        Nothocercus julius Tawny-breasted Tinamou Perdiz de Pecho Leonado #> 3    Nothocercus bonapartei       Highland Tinamou          Perdiz Montesa #> 4 Nothocercus nigrocapillus         Hooded Tinamou  Perdiz de Cabeza Negra #> 5               Tinamus tao           Gray Tinamou             Perdiz Gris #> 6           Tinamus osgoodi          Black Tinamou            Perdiz Negra #>          order    family status #> 1   Rheiformes   Rheidae   nill #> 2 Tinamiformes Tinamidae   nill #> 3 Tinamiformes Tinamidae   nill #> 4 Tinamiformes Tinamidae   nill #> 5 Tinamiformes Tinamidae   nill #> 6 Tinamiformes Tinamidae   nill

what: Retrieve Data from the List of the Birds of Peru — search_avesperu
title: Retrieve Data from the List of the Birds of Peru — search_avesperu
text: function takes list birds species names, searches data avesperu pacakage dataset, returns data frame containing relevant information species.

title: Retrieve Data from the List of the Birds of Peru — search_avesperu
Retrieve Data from the List of the Birds of Peru — search_avesperu
text: splist character vector containing names species search . max_distance maximum allowed distance fuzzy matching species names. Defaults 0.1.

title: Retrieve Data from the List of the Birds of Peru — search_avesperu
text: data frame containing retrieved information species.

title: Retrieve Data from the List of the Birds of Peru — search_avesperu
text: function allows fuzzy matching species names maximum distance threshold handle potential typos variations species names.

title: Retrieve Data from the List of the Birds of Peru — search_avesperu
code: splist <- c("Falco sparverius", "Tinamus osgodi", "Crypturellus sooui",             "Thraupisa palamarum", "Thamnophilus praecox")  search_avesperu(splist) #>        name_submitted     accepted_name     english_name        spanish_name #> 1    Falco sparverius  Falco sparverius American Kestrel Cernícalo Americano #> 2      Tinamus osgodi   Tinamus osgoodi    Black Tinamou        Perdiz Negra #> 3  Crypturellus sooui Crypturellus soui   Little Tinamou        Perdiz Chica #> 4 Thraupisa palamarum Thraupis palmarum     Palm Tanager Tangara de Palmeras #>           order     family status dist #> 1 Falconiformes Falconidae   nill    0 #> 2  Tinamiformes  Tinamidae   nill    1 #> 3  Tinamiformes  Tinamidae   nill    1 #> 4 Passeriformes Thraupidae   nill    2
